description:
I created an image using launchpad-testing/image.manifest.xml which defaulted to aki-00000082.  That kernel image was deleted, so I re-registered the image to use a new kernel.  But it still used the old one:

$ euca-register launchpad-testing/image.manifest.xml --kernel aki-0000009e --ramdisk ari-0000009f
IMAGE	ami-000000ae
$ euca-run-instances ami-000000ae
ImageNotFound: Image 82 could not be found.
title: euca-register does not respect --kernel

comments.content:
I created an image using launchpad-testing/image.manifest.xml which defaulted to aki-00000082.  That kernel image was deleted, so I re-registered the image to use a new kernel.  But it still used the old one:

$ euca-register launchpad-testing/image.manifest.xml --kernel aki-0000009e --ramdisk ari-0000009f
IMAGE	ami-000000ae
$ euca-run-instances ami-000000ae
ImageNotFound: Image 82 could not be found.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~abentley

comments.content:
I suspect that the issue is that the KernelId and RamdiskId to RegisterImage [1] are just being ignored.

[1] http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-RegisterImage.html
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~smoser

comments.content:
I suspect this is true.  As a workaround, you could edit the kernel and ramdisk in the manifest.xml and re-register.

On Sep 29, 2011, at 11:06 AM, Aaron Bentley wrote:

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content: You can also specify a different kernel and/or ramdisk when you call run-instances.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vishvananda

comments.content:
On Thu, 29 Sep 2011, Vish Ishaya wrote:

> I suspect this is true.  As a workaround, you could edit the kernel and
> ramdisk in the manifest.xml and re-register.

You should (hopefully) have to re-sign the manifest again.  That, and the
fact that you dont' have manifest.xml locally, but rather uploaded it make
this a bit more of a pain.   Worst case you have download the bundle, and
rebundle and upload.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~smoser

comments.content:
I think the following patch addresses the issue.


From f74310788613467fe3ceef6614ea7939ffe77896 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
Message-Id: <email address hidden>
In-Reply-To: <email address hidden>
References: <email address hidden>
From: Isaku Yamahata <email address hidden>
Date: Mon, 21 Nov 2011 15:06:55 +0900
Subject: [PATCH] images/s3: fix 81c8c3ab19d838e14c528753854340a8a4b4f66a

The c/s of 81c8c3ab19d838e14c528753854340a8a4b4f66a has typo.
It caused euca-register to ignore kernel_id, ramdisk_id.
This patch fixes it.

---
 nova/image/s3.py |    2 +-
 1 files changed, 1 insertions(+), 1 deletions(-)

diff --git a/nova/image/s3.py b/nova/image/s3.py
index ea0882d..a9775c0 100644
--- a/nova/image/s3.py
+++ b/nova/image/s3.py
@@ -216,7 +216,7 @@ class S3ImageService(object):
         def _translate_dependent_image_id(image_key, image_id):
             image_id = ec2utils.ec2_id_to_id(image_id)
             image_uuid = self.get_image_uuid(context, image_id)
-            properties['image_id'] = image_uuid
+            properties[image_key] = image_uuid
 
         if kernel_id:
             _translate_dependent_image_id('kernel_id', kernel_id)
-- 
1.7.1.1
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yamahata

comments.content:
related to the following bugs:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/827617
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/890486

Both have been fixed already.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudayou
